property.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-executor.class
property.description: This is the container executor setting that ensures that all applications are started with the LinuxContainerExecutor.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.group
property.description: The POSIX group of the NodeManager. It should match the setting in "container-executor.cfg". This configuration is required for validating the secure access of the container-executor binary.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.nonsecure-mode.limit-users
property.description: Whether all applications should be run as the NodeManager process' owner. When false, applications are launched instead as the application owner.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.allowed-runtimes
property.description: Comma separated list of runtimes that are allowed when using LinuxContainerExecutor. The allowed values are default, docker, and javasandbox.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.type
property.description: Optional. Sets the default container runtime to use.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.image-name
property.description: Optional. Default docker image to be used when the docker runtime is selected.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.image-update
property.description: Optional. Default option to decide whether to pull the latest image or not.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.allowed-container-networks
property.description: Optional. A comma-separated set of networks allowed when launching containers. Valid values are determined by Docker networks available from `docker network ls`

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.default-container-network
property.description: The network used when launching Docker containers when no network is specified in the request. This network must be one of the (configurable) set of allowed container networks.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.host-pid-namespace.allowed
property.description: Optional. Whether containers are allowed to use the host PID namespace.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.privileged-containers.allowed
property.description: Optional. Whether applications are allowed to run in privileged containers. Privileged containers are granted the complete set of capabilities and are not subject to the limitations imposed by the device cgroup controller. In other words, privileged containers can do almost everything that the host can do. Use with extreme care.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.delayed-removal.allowed
property.description: Optional. Whether or not users are allowed to request that Docker containers honor the debug deletion delay. This is useful for troubleshooting Docker container related launch failures.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.stop.grace-period
property.description: Optional. A configurable value to pass to the Docker Stop command. This value defines the number of seconds between the docker stop command sending a SIGTERM and a SIGKILL.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.privileged-containers.acl
property.description: Optional. A comma-separated list of users who are allowed to request privileged containers if privileged containers are allowed.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.capabilities
property.description: Optional. This configuration setting determines the capabilities assigned to docker containers when they are launched. While these may not be case-sensitive from a docker perspective, it is best to keep these uppercase. To run without any capabilites, set this value to "none" or "NONE"

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.enable-userremapping.allowed
property.description: Optional. Whether docker containers are run with the UID and GID of the calling user.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.userremapping-uid-threshold
property.description: Optional. The minimum acceptable UID for a remapped user. Users with UIDs lower than this value will not be allowed to launch containers when user remapping is enabled.

property.name: yarn.nodemanager.runtime.linux.docker.userremapping-gid-threshold
property.description: Optional. The minimum acceptable GID for a remapped user. Users belonging to any group with a GID lower than this value will not be allowed to launch containers when user remapping is enabled.
